NoAuthentication

The final details should be as shown below: 

Image 40

You should be able to see all 4 destinations configured as shown below:

Image 41

7. SAP Build Work Zone - Content Provider

7.1 Content Provider for SAP Ariba Sourcing Solutions

We will be setting up the content provider from your SAP Ariba Sourcing realm, for which you will need access to your SAP Build Work Zone as an administrator. Navigate to Channel Manager and create the following Content Channels, click on New, and ensure the following details below:

 

Field

Value

Title

SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing solution or any other meaningful name

ID

ariba_sourcing

Design-Time Destination

Select the design time destination source

Runtime Destination

Select the runtime destination

Runtime Destination for Dynamic Data

The runtime destination for retrieving dynamic data to display on dynamic tiles. Keep the default value.

Automatically add all content items to the subaccount

true

Use the Identity Provisioning service to provision user authorizations

true

You should be able to see the setup as below.

Image 42

7.2 Content Provider for SAP Ariba Procurement Solutions

We will be setting up the content provider from your SAP Ariba Buyer realm, for which you will need access to your SAP Build Work Zone as an administrator. Navigate to Channel Manager and create the following Content Channels, click on New, and ensure the following details below:

 

Field

Value

Title

SAP Ariba Procurement solution or any other meaningful name

ID

ariba_buyer

Design-Time Destination

Select the design time destination

Runtime Destination

Select the runtime destination

Runtime Destination for Dynamic Data

The runtime destination for retrieving dynamic data to display on dynamic tiles. By default, the default runtime destination is used.

Automatically add all content items to subaccount

true

Use the Identity Provisioning service to provision user authorizations

true

You should be able to see the setup as below. 

Image 43

7.3 Channel Updates

While creating both the above Content Providers for the Sourcing and Buyer system, the status should be “Created”; you can click on the refresh icon under the action options.

Image 44

The status should be as shown below for both realms. If there are any errors, it could be because a setting in your DT or RT in step 5 is missing/incorrect. Please ensure you have validated them. 

 

8. Configure Identity Provisioning Service from IAS to SAP Build Work Zone

In this step, we will set up the Source and Target services to ensure we replicate the SAP Ariba roles to the SAP Build Work Zone.

8.1 Configure the Source System

In this step, we are going to use the existing SAP Source System that was created during the SAP Ariba ICM process. This Source system can be reused for the user replication form IAS to SAP Build Work Zone also.

Note:

  • If you have integrated CIS with SAP Ariba without the ICM process, you may have to manually create the source system as per the help portal. Later, follow the steps below.

 In my case for the blog, we are using the source system “IAS for Ariba Buyer XXXXX_XGB – source” that was created during the ICM process.

 

8.2 Configure Target Systems

Based on your system integrations for SAP Ariba Realms, you will create the required Target systems. In our case, we are going to create two target systems, one for the Buyer and one for Sourcing.

8.2.1 SAP Ariba Buyer Target

You can either follow the new setup or simply import the Buyer Target file that is made available to you “8.2.1 IAS to WZ for Ariba Buyer Target System.json”

To create a new one, you will need to follow the settings below:

 

Field

Value

Type

SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition

Name

Any meaningful name (Work Zone-Target)

Description

Any meaningful description

Source System

Select the IAS source system created previously.

If you simply import the Buyer Target file, you should be able to see the details below. Ensure to modify the values to meet your setup.

Image 45

If you have manually created a Target System, navigate to Transformation and switch to JSON view, click on Edit, and add the following attribute mapping for the group entity.

Skip this step if you have done a file import, as this is taken care.

 

Property

Value

Description

Mapping

Sample Code

{

    "sourcePath": "$.displayName",

    "optional": true,

    "targetPath": "$.externalId",

    "functions": [

        {

            "function": "replaceAllString",

            "regex": " ",

            "replacement": "_"

        }

    ]

}

Ensures the externalId field of the SCIM entity groups is set to externalId.

 

It should be as shown below:

 

Image 46

Save the settings and click on the Properties tab to add the following details below.

 

Field

Value

URL

portal-service field value under endpoints node from the service key

Authentication

BasicAuthentication

clientid field value under uaa node from the service key

Password

clientsecret field value under uaa node from the service key

ProxyType

Internet

Type

HTTP

OAuth2TokenServiceURL

https://<uaa url>/oauth/token

cflp.group.unique.attribute

externalId,['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:2.0:mapping']['providerId']

cflp.patch.group.members.above.threshold

5000

ariba_buyer

emails[0].value,['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:2.0:mapping']['providerId'],externalId

ips.trace.failed.entity.content

true

 

The values are from your SAP Build Work Zone Service Key file, as shown below:

Image 47

8.2.2 SAP Ariba Sourcing – Target

You can either follow the new setup or simply import the Sourcing Target file that is made available to you, “8.2.2 IAS to WZ for Ariba Sourcing Target System.json”

Or

You can simply export your SAP Ariba Buyer Target that was created in the step above and edit the naming to Sourcing, as shown below.

 

Image 48

Ensure the values are accurate from your SAP Build Work Zone Service Key and click on Save.

 

Image 49

8.3 Run the Sync Job

To run the sync of users and groups to SAP Build Work Zone, you can navigate to SAP Cloud Identity Services, click on the IAS for Ariba Buyer—XXXX_XGB services you have used for target mapping, and click on Jobs. Here, you can click Run Now, as shown below.

Image 50

 You can go to the Provisioning logs to see the user and user groups updated to the SAP Build Work Zone, as shown below. 

Image 51

If you look at the logs, you will see that User and Group READ from SAP IAS as the Source system and the WRITE action of User and Group to the Target system SAP Ariba Buyer, SAP Build Woke Zone for Buyer & Sourcing.  

In case of failed users, you may have to check the logs and fix them.  

This completes the Ariba integration with Joule.

Note: You may need to schedule regular jobs to ensure that the User, Groups, and Roles are synced with your SAP Build Work Zones.

 

9. Joule Test Scenarios

The Joule icon should now be visible in your SAP Ariba Systems. You can log in to the Joule service and use the services listed in the SAP Ariba Joule Capabilities.

Image 52

Congratulations. You have successfully activated Joule in SAP Ariba Realms, and it should be visible in your Buyer and Sourcing system.

PS: Thanks to the SAP Ariba Team and the Joule Engineering team for helping to put this blog together. 

Happy Learning!!!

 Regards,
Nagesh Caparthy

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
Well, look at this: 

That is correct, we are moving to the old approach where S/P users will login individually with their SAP ID passwords and that is the whole change.

UID password will remain as password for account.sap.com as the wallet where individuals can manage their S/P users and SAP ID passwords.

the customer is always right, or? 

While the Universal ID wasn't perfect, it worked reasonably well.   The "NEW" Solution promises to be better (log in once and move from S-ID to S-ID without logging out.....Excellent!) but SAP disabling the old when the new isn't ready is a real head scratcher.

Dear @SAP,  dear @Cuneyt, @Akhat_12 this is a clear No-Go, as the open feedback here shows, that this move is not thought through. I even want to ask yourself: when you state things like this, are you even aware of the time-spent out in the field, searching for the right logins? 

We apologize for the temporary inconvenience caused by the need to manage multiple user identities and manually switch between them due to the recent changes. SAP is currently developing an account switcher functionality to alleviate this issue.

Please, just search on all the SAP websites and product, which ones really have a Logout-Button present, even not speaking for an account-view that gives information above a pure name or initials. (at least I could name a dozen, where there is no logout button). And if i cannot log out as a user, the session will stay active, as people do not tend to use business software on 5 browsers that often, when being bound to only one corporate browser. 

Your arguments are thin like paper and the quick shots as well as spoken of account switcher functionality is no where to be seen yet. 

Can we please at least go back to "normal", with a functioning UID and not again to the stone-age with users being left in the rain to log in tediously into S-/X-User-Accounts.

What is presented to users in the Note: https://me.sap.com/notes/3650023/E is not reasonable to explain to any (business, not even technically oriented) user, nor any consultant or partner and a big shot in the foot. Users will search for Logout Button on the various platforms and not find them. 

Welcome to chaos .... 

what is even the distinction between: 

account.sap.com

accounts.sap.com

me.sap.com

Universal ID

just confusing. people will not get it.

 

P.S.: no clue from which account am am typing these angry lines.

entry.title: Announcing the SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Classroom Training
entry.content:
The sales landscape is evolving at a breakneck pace, driven by AI, cloud transformation, and the demand for ultimate sales productivity. To meet this change head-on, we are thrilled to announce the official release of our foundational classroom training: C4H470: SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 .

This in-depth, instructor-led course is not just a review of new features—it is a comprehensive deep dive designed to elevate the skills of every professional involved in the SAP Sales Cloud ecosystem.

Why You Can’t Afford to Miss This Course

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 is a massive leap forward, and this training is your guided path to mastering its power. Designed for both business users and administrators, C4H470 focuses on practical, hands-on application:

1. Harness the Power of AI and Intelligent Sales

Dive into the future of sales by leveraging Machine Learning and Gen AI capabilities. You will learn the applications of the CX AI Toolkit and Lead Intelligence to automate and optimize decision-making, ensuring smarter lead scoring and a decisive competitive advantage.

2. Hands-On Mastery of Productivity Tools

Empower yourself and your sales teams with advanced tactics for opportunity management and pipeline execution. You will gain hands-on experience with:

  • Guided Selling App: Utilizing playbooks to manage opportunity progression and ensure adherence to sales methodology.

  • Pipeline Manager: Optimizing pipeline performance and identifying critical sales trends.

  • Forecast Tracker: Improving forecast accuracy and monitoring sales performance effectively.

  • Digital Selling Workspace: Organizing and prioritizing sales actions with enhanced task management features.

3. Core System Proficiency and Administration

The course provides the confidence needed to navigate the system's new architecture and configuration. Key modules include:

  • Comprehensive Configuration: Tailoring core components like Leads, Opportunities, Quotes, Sales Orders, and Visits to reflect your business-specific processes.

  • Effective Administration: Mastering the daily workflow, including user setup, advanced configurations, and data management.

  • Seamless Collaboration: Configuring and leveraging communication tools, such as Microsoft Teams Integration and Relationship Intelligence, to streamline sales execution.

Who Needs This Essential Training?

Whether you are a key decision-maker or on the front lines of sales technology, this course is essential.

Audience

System Administrators

Application Consultants

Business Users

Super/Key Power Users

This is your opportunity to elevate your skills, secure your expertise in the latest SAP release, and actively drive business growth.

Elevate your skills and stay ahead in the ever-evolving sales landscape. Register now for C4H470 to secure your spot!

entry.title: Re: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable i...
entry.content:
Usually this happens because the entity you are updating is not applicable to the corresponding product type. For example, trying to post a plant view that does not apply to that type (Purchasing view to a Sales -related product type). The error message is not helpful.

Try to use a test product for which you know you can manually create the entities you need to maintain via API.

Regards,

Luciano

entry.title: Re: CDS View for Budget, Commitment
entry.content:
Hello @Prajyot_Yerunkar 

Utilise the released CDS: create a customised CDS view using I_PubSecBdgtActlItemCube (which includes budget, commitments, and actuals), joined to I_WBSElementBasicData (containing WBS and project information).SAP Help-Virtual Data Model and CDS Views-Budget and Commitment/Actual Items Cube

If the specified cube is not available in your tenant, use I_ActualPlanJournalEntryItem for actuals and plans, and add a commitment or budget source according to what has been released within your scope. Combine these elements into a single Custom CDS at the WBS SAP Help Virtual Data Model and CDS Views-Actual Plan for Journal Entry Item

Useful SAP Help References

Budget and Commitment/Actual Items Cube – I_PubSecBdgtActlItemCube. SAP Help Portal

Basic WBS Element Data – I_WBSElementBasicData. SAP Help Portal

Actual/Plan (alternative for actuals/plan) – I_ActualPlanJournalEntryItem. SAP Help Portal

Useful KBAs for when views don’t show up / how to locate released CDS

2974010 – How to find a valid CDS view or API (Business Accelerator Hub / View Browser). SAP Support Portal-2974010 - How to find a valid CDS view or API

3165745 – Cannot find some released CDS views in the Custom CDS View app (troubleshooting visibility). SAP Support Portal-3165745 - Cannot find some released CDS views from the app Custom CDS View

3558790 – How to find released BAdIs or CDS views (search approach). SAP Support-3558790 - How to find released BAdIs or CDS views

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: HTTPS on RESTful web service running on tomcat
entry.content:
It's unclear from your question when the 500 error occurs — is it during login to BI Launchpad, while using the RESTful SDK, or in another context?

in general:

• Ensure the URL protocol matches your Tomcat server configuration.
If Tomcat is set up with SSL (HTTPS), then your RESTful service URLs must also use HTTPS.
(you can configure this in CMC -> applications -->  RESTful url)
• If you're using a load balancer, make sure it is properly configured to handle SSL termination and forward requests correctly to the backend servers.

...

hope it helps

entry.title: Update Label for CGrp 13 in APO from “BPD – XPANSE” to “BPD – FRD”
entry.content:
I want to update the label for “CGrp 13” in the APO system.
Currently, the value is displayed as “BPD – XPANSE”, but it should instead show as “BPD – FRD.”

This label appears in APO planning books/data views, where users select or view the characteristic group (CGrp) during planning and reporting. The objective is to make sure that the correct business name (“BPD – FRD”) is reflected consistently wherever CGrp 13 is used — both in the selection group (SCGrp 130) and in BW master data texts, if applicable.

entry.title: Re: Impact of a U.S. Federal Government Shutdown on E-Verify
entry.content: @JulieMcSwain  I am curious what you mean by refresh data with DHS? One of my users got a tentative non-confirmation and we were wondering if it is a glitch or does she just need to follow the instructions?
